name: White Bread
problem: White bread is made from refined flour and lacks fiber, vitamins, and minerals compared to whole grain options
improve: Pair white bread with protein (e.g., turkey, hummus) and healthy fats (e.g., avocado) to boost its nutritional value. You can also add fresh vegetables or use it as a base for nutrient-dense sandwiches or wraps

name: French Fries
problem: Fried potatoes are high in unhealthy fats and calories, but low in essential nutrients
improve: Make homemade oven-baked fries using sweet potatoes or carrots for extra vitamins and minerals. Pair with a healthy protein source like grilled chicken or fish for a more balanced meal

name: Instant Noodles
problem: Instant noodles are often low in nutrients and high in sodium and preservatives
improve: Add vegetables (spinach, broccoli, or mushrooms) and a protein source (like tofu, chicken, or boiled eggs) to increase the fiber, vitamins, and minerals. Use low-sodium broth instead of the seasoning packet
